discourse_list.title: UNI-V2-WBTC-DAI should we promote DAI pair by creating Vault?

content.content: As USDC-ETH / DAI-ETH are under discussion, Currently WBTC-USDC pair is use to convert any type of USD coin, with curve/shell/ via a route DAI->USDC->WBTC. The WBTC-DAI pair is 20k and it is counterpart WBTC-USDC pair is 16M. Uniswap pair increase only if there is enough liquidity into it, then routes pass through it. By creating a vault, we should help to give some push to the liquidity and help Dai to become a major currency. Risk should be lower than WBTC itself and Uniswap contract is already checked. It is more about stimulated Dai than really about the return itself. further more we should probably look into all existing collaterals type we already have paired with Dai.
content.GPT-summary: The author proposes creating a Vault to promote the DAI pair, as the WBTC-DAI pair has low liquidity compared to the WBTC-USDC pair. The author believes that creating a Vault will help stimulate DAI and make it a major currency. The proposal is open to constructive criticism and the author suggests looking into existing collateral types paired with DAI.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: I fully agree that we need to make DAI the stablecoin centerpiece of Uniswap and not let USDC gain market share. We should preempt all pairs we support (like PAXG-DAI soon). Even using a bit of Maker capital if needed to bootstrap liquidity.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: I fully support this proposal. The circulation value of WBTC on ETH is getting bigger and bigger, and it is more and more recognized by people. It is time to accelerate the occupation of this market.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
